00011 /*
00012  * Computes the efficiency using the SPIFF algorithm
00013  *
00014  * @param       n                                               number of particle types in the mixed particle field (pointer to single variable)
00015  * @param       E_MeV_u                                 energy of particles in the mixed particle field (pointer to array of size n)
00016  * @param       particle_no                             type of the particles in the mixed particle field (pointer to array of size n)
00017  * @see                                                         SGP_Data.h for definition
00018  * @param       fluence_cm2                             fluences for the given particles, doses in Gy if negative (pointer to array of size n)
00019  * @param       material_no                             index number for detector material (pointer to single variable)
00020  * @see                                                         SGP_Constants.h for definition
00021  * @param       RDD_model                               index number for chosen radial dose distribution (pointer to single variable)
00022  * @param       RDD_parameters                  parameters for chosen radial dose distribution (pointer to array of size depending on chosen model)
00023  * @see                                                         SGP_Constants.h for definition
00024  * @param       ER_model                                index number for chosen electron-range model (pointer to single variable)
00025  * @param       ER_parameters                   parameters for chosen electron-range model (pointer to array of size depending on chosen model)
00026  * @see                                                         SGP_Constants.h for definition
00027  * @param       gamma_model                             index number for chosen gamma response (pointer to single variable)
00028  * @param       gamma_parameters                parameters for chosen gamma response (pointer to array of size depending on chosen model)
00029  * @see                                                         SGP_Constants.h for definition
00030  * @param       N2                                              (algorithm specific) number of bins per factor of two in local dose array (pointer to single variable)
00031  * @param       fluence_factor                  factor to scale the fluences given as "fluence_cm2" with (pointer to single variable)
00032  * @param       write_output                    if true, a protocol is written to "SuccessiveConvolutions.txt" in the working directory (pointer to single variable)
00033  * @param       shrink_tails                    (algorithm specific) if true, tails of the local dose distribution, contributing less than "shrink_tails_under" are cut (pointer to single variable)
00034  * @param       shrink_tails_under              (algorithm specific) limit for tail cutting in local dose distribution (pointer to single variable)
00035  * @param       adjust_N2                               (algorithm specific) if true, "N2" will be increase if necessary at high fluence to ensure sufficient binning resolution
00036  * @param       results                                 pointer to array of size 10 to be allocated by the user which will be used to return the results
00037  *                      results[0]                              efficiency                              (algorithm independent) main result:    particle response at dose D / gamma response at dose D
00038  *                      results[1]                              d_check                                 (algorithm independent) sanity check:   total dose (in Gy) as returned by the alogrithm
00039  *                      results[2]                              S_HCP                                   (algorithm independent)                                 absolute particle response
00040  *                      results[3]                              S_gamma                                 (algorithm independent)                                 absolute gamma response
00041  *                      results[4]                              not used                                (algorithm independent)
00042  *                      results[5]                              u                                               (algorithm specific)                                    mean number of tracks contributing to representative point
00043  *                      results[6]                              u_start                                 (algorithm specific)                                    low starting value for mean number of tracks, where linearisation is applied
00044  *                      results[7]                              n_convolutions                  (algorithm specific)                                    number of convolutions performed
00045  *                      results[8]                              not used                                (algorithm specific)
00046  *                      results[9]                              not used                                (algorithm specific)
00047  * @return                                                      none
00048  */
00049 void SGP_efficiency(    long*   n,
00050                                                 float*  E_MeV_u,
00051                                                 long*   particle_no,
00052                                                 float*  fluence_cm2,
00053                                                 long*   material_no,
00054                                                 long*   RDD_model,
00055                                                 float*  RDD_parameters,
00056                                                 long*   ER_model,
00057                                                 float*  ER_parameters,
00058                                                 long*   gamma_model,
00059                                                 float*  gamma_parameters,
00060                                                 long*   N2                                      = 10,
00061                                                 float*  fluence_factor          = 1.0f,
00062                                                 int*    write_output            = true,
00063                                                 int*    shrink_tails            = true,
00064                                                 float*  shrink_tails_under      = 1e-30f,
00065                                                 int*    adjust_N2                       = true,
00066                                                 float*  results);
00067
